meanings.def: the act of being present at a place, for example at school
examples: Attendance at these lectures is not compulsory.
Teachers must keep a record of students' attendances.

meanings.def: the number of people present at an organized event
examples: There was an attendance of 42 at the meeting.
Cinema attendances have risen again recently.
The average attendance at matches increased last year.
It was a record attendance for a midweek game.
Despite falling attendances, the zoo will stay open.
Building a new stadium has boosted attendances by 40%.
Attendances at the pool always fall in winter.

meanings.def: to be present at a special event
examples: Several heads of state were in attendance at the funeral.

meanings.def: to be with or near somebody in order to help them if necessary
examples: He always has at least two bodyguards in attendance.
The ambulances were in attendance within 22 minutes.

meanings.def: to be with somebody and do things to help and please them
to check who is present and who is not present at a place and to mark this information on a list of names
examples: Mrs Sakamoto had finished taking attendance.
